page.title: 07BUCKNALL SCHOOL - GENERAL
page.content: {Bucknall County Primary School}was built in 1854. (It is now 131 years old). It has two classrooms, two sets of toilets, an office, and a kitchen which was closed about 4 years ago, and which we expect to be converted into an art & craft room this summer. The staff is: Mr Kirk, Headteacher, Mrs Bown, Infant Teacher, Mrs Goulsbra, secretary, and Mrs Blakey, dinner-time supervisor and caretaker. There are 44 children. 19 of these are Infants (4-7), and 25 are juniors (7-11). This is the largest roll for at least 25 years. Children from {Bucknall, Stixwould}and{Horsington come to this school. There is a large playground, but no field. The school sometimes uses the one year old village hall for drama etc. The school building has been altered greatly in the last seven years.
